ygData.subject: RE: Re: Archmage Answers
ygData.msgSnippet: Also to add, if I made mistakes at work this regularly, not only would everyone go over everything I did with a fine toothed comb, but I d have been unemployed
ygData.messageBody:
Also to add, if I made mistakes at work this regularly, not only would
everyone go over everything I did with a fine toothed comb, but I'd have
been unemployed by now if I continually told them "but I tested that" when
it eas so obvious I didn't.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 3:55 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Archmage Answers


From: jhenders@...

On Fri, Feb 04/00, Blitz Krieg <blitz_krieg@...> wrote:
>
> I couldn't imagine being in a job where EVERY thing I did was questioned,
> analyzed, reanalyzed, condemned and 2nd guessed at least 140,000 times.
> Where you do something you see as positive and a section of people will
> always think it sucks. How many changes went into the patch? 1 or 2
things
> they missed for whatever reason doesn't account for much. Especially when
> they WILL be fixed sooner rather than later. Shit does happen and I'm
glad
> someone (or 170,000 someone's) isn't there nitpicking at every move I
make.

I can't imagine doing a job, screwing up not once but a couple of times,
and then not being particularly careful to make sure I don't screw up at
least that one area again the next time I do something. I mean, this has
happened to bards consistantly now for 6 months. Wouldn't most people
make extra sure they checked that area of things carefully after having
let out the first couple of errors? Personally, I don't like looking
like an idiot in public and that to me is what these repeated mistakes
make them look like.

--
Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
